snippet: On Sunday, Mexicans turned out in large numbers to vote for a change in priorities and approach. As president-elect, I have plans to alleviate poverty and fight drug trafficking and organized crime.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Mexico's Pres-elect Enrique Pena Nieto disputes that his election signals a return to the old ways of his party, the Institutional Revolutionary Party; outlines what he intends to do as president.
lead_paragraph: On Sunday, Mexicans turned out in large numbers to vote for a change in priorities and approach. As president-elect, I have plans to alleviate poverty and fight drug trafficking and organized crime.
